questions.q: What is the primary function of a switch in a network?
questions.explanation: Switches primarily filter and forward packets within the same network [1].
options: To route data between different networks
To filter and forward packets within the same network
To provide security by blocking unauthorized access
To connect end devices to the internet

questions.q: Which device is primarily responsible for directing data packets between different networks?
questions.explanation: Routers direct data packets between separate networks [1].

questions.q: What is the main purpose of a firewall in a network?
questions.explanation: A firewall's main purpose is to monitor and control network traffic [1, 2].
options: To increase the speed of data transmission
To connect multiple devices within a local area network
To monitor and control incoming and outgoing network traffic
To store data for backup purposes

questions.q: Which of the following statements is true about routers?
questions.explanation: Routers are capable of connecting different types of networks [2].
options: They operate only at the physical layer of the OSI model.
They can connect different types of networks.
They are used to connect devices within the same local area network.
They do not perform any filtering of data packets.

questions.q: In a network, what role does a client typically play?
questions.explanation: A client requests services and resources from servers [2, 3].
options: It provides resources and services to other devices.
It requests services and resources from servers.
It routes data between different networks.
It secures the network from unauthorized access.

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a function of a switch?
questions.explanation: Routing packets between different networks is a router function, not a switch function [3].
options: Forwarding frames based on MAC addresses
Creating a separate collision domain for each port

questions.q: What type of network device can be used to create a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external networks?
questions.explanation: Firewalls create a barrier between trusted and untrusted networks [3, 4].

questions.q: Which layer of the OSI model do switches primarily operate at?
questions.explanation: Switches primarily operate at the Data link layer [4].

questions.q: What is the main difference between a hub and a switch?
questions.explanation: A switch sends data specifically to the intended recipient, unlike a hub which broadcasts to all ports [4, 5].
options: A hub can filter traffic, while a switch cannot.
A switch can connect to multiple networks, while a hub cannot.
A switch sends data only to the intended recipient, while a hub broadcasts to all ports.
A hub operates at the network layer, while a switch operates at the data link layer.

questions.q: Which of the following devices is essential for connecting a local area network (LAN) to the internet?
questions.explanation: A router is essential for connecting a LAN to the internet [5].

questions.q: Which of the following best describes a switch's operation?
questions.explanation: A switch creates a dedicated path for data between devices [5].
options: It operates at the application layer and manages user requests.
It uses IP addresses to forward data packets.
It creates a dedicated path for data between devices.
It broadcasts data to all connected devices.

questions.q: Firewalls can be categorized into which of the following types?
questions.explanation: Firewalls are categorized into hardware and software types [6].

questions.q: What is a common feature of managed switches compared to unmanaged switches?
questions.explanation: Managed switches provide advanced configuration options [6].

questions.q: What type of network topology is commonly used with switches?
questions.explanation: Star topology is commonly used with switches [6, 7].

questions.q: Which of the following statements about firewalls is true?
questions.explanation: Firewalls can be used to create a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) [7].
options: Firewalls can be used to create a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone).
Firewalls are only necessary for large networks.

questions.q: What is the primary function of a network interface card (NIC)?
questions.explanation: The NIC's function is to connect a computer to a network [7, 8].
options: To connect a computer to a network
